Posts.Content: Jul 28, 2012 11:40PM - edited Jul 28, 2012 11:42PM by Shayne Abby - i was the same way.....started looking at EVERYthing I was using, touching, eating, wearing.....I just took baby steps, worked on clean diet first, which included seeing an ND to learn more about nutrition and estrogen avoiding foods.....(I drink green smoothies every day), then looking at lotions and makeup for parabens, even soap and shampoo - both for me and my daughter.  Most everything I used was already paraben free, so it was just a couple changes there.....green cleaning products...switched to using oils instead of lotions... My Onc said not to get to paranoid about food etc - but its what I can control....so i feel better not eating gluten, dairy, and limiting organic meats and alcohol...no coffee.....I feel better than I have in months and  so glad to be on the other side of this nightmare - and youll be there too, v v soon!  The waiting is hard, believe me, we all know.....distraction, family, girlfriends...exercise, pets.....funny movies, xanax - all were lifesavers during this time for me......Reach out - people in your life want to be there for you - they feel as helpless as you do in this.....  Sending lots of love and compassion your way today -

Posts.Content: Jan 9, 2013 09:08AM Shayne wrote: I had 3 cysts found when i had my first mammo.  I have always had fibrocystic breasts.  My first mammo was at age 54.  They also found dcis - calcifications and also a very very small lesion. I asked the rad onc about the cysts.  She told me they come and go on their own.  She also said she had a woman who would come in twice a year because hers got painfully large.  Then she stopped coming.  When the doc saw her for a routine mammo, she was cyst-free - after years of having them.  The doc asked her what she was doing different -and the woman said she was taking ground flax seeds daily.  Not sure if this will work for everyone, but I found it interesting.

Posts.Content: Apr 26, 2012 02:07PM Shayne wrote: The study posted seems a bit skewed in my opinion.  ONly medicare patients, only women over 66, and only women with INVASIVE cancer.  Hmmmm......that is a very select few.  I am also stage 0, dcis, and my lesion is only 12mm.....no lymphs or other tissue involved.  So feel my odds are better.  When you look at the risk of external radiation - and the side effects, Brachy looks better for me.  Also, they have been using this method in Europe for a lot longer.  US is always a little behind if you ask me.   Just my opinion - its good to read all the studies, but like I said - it was a very select group that they studied which makes it not a very good overall study.......

Posts.Content: May 29, 2013 10:10AM - edited May 29, 2013 10:11AM by Shayne Hey ebab- sorry for your delay.  They tried to delay mine - due to their scheduling issues - and I had a mini breakdown - and they worked with me.  Yes, the week after I was tired.  But if i had an event I could have rallied for it......so I think youll be ok, esp 5 days out.  Just eat well and take care of yourself.   Are you having the Savi device?  If so, yes it is big.....but I had no problem with it, even sleeping with it - and Im a bit of a princess and the pea type too.  Make sure you have something for anxiety or pain so you can get sleep at night.  I was really worried about them taking it out, and took a 1/2 pain med and felt nothing.  If you have any questions/concerns, feel free to message me privately if you want.  Good luck!  Youll do well - it was a pretty easy experience all in all. Its been a year since mine and looking back, I would have chose the same treatment.

Posts.Content: Shayne wrote: Hi everyone.  Im 54 and just had my first mamo - showing 3 cysts, one that appeared solid looking or filled with blood on the ultrasound.  There were also a cluster of micro calcifications.  Im set to go to the city on Friday to a wonderful Breast Center for a biopsy.  I have 3 friends in my community that have recently been diagnosed with BC.  I have 1 sister who was diagnosed with bc 5 years ago, otherwise no other family history.  I have 2 children, one is 35 and the other is 11.  I nursed for 3 years with my 11 yr old.  I am post menopausal and did take bio-identical hormones for 2 years.  I weaned myself off of them when my sister was diagnosed.  None of my cysts can be felt - the biggest is 10mm.  They were all oval shaped with clear margins/edges. I wasnt scared, until the woman setting up my appt mentioned the microcalcifications - now Im super worried, trying to stay off the internet.   She said they MIGHT have to do a sterotactic biopsy on the calcifications, but wont know until they see my films.  My films were SUPPOSE to be Fed X to them Monday, but are being shipped today bc someone forgot!  They usually do not make appts without seeing and having the films first, but my friend who had BC a couple years ago and went to this Breast Center, made some calls for me and got me in.   I have a lot of support - but my husband is out of town and I feel very alone with this.  My sisters both live 2 states away but I have been talking to them on the phone.  Im trying to stay positive, but fear is overtaking me every 15 min or so.  Making the appt yesterday made it so real - i thought I would feel relieved, but Im not.  I have read a lot of posts on how easy the biopsy is.  Im a huge baby when it comes to needles and anything medical.  Im a v healthy person, exercise 5 x a week, have never had anything major happen to me besides having my gall bladder removed 20 years ago.  Looking for someone to talk me off the ledge - Im so scared and worried - even tho I know how useless these emotions are.  I feel like Im trying to hold it together and Im barely able to do it.  thanks for any replies and words of hope! Posts.Content: Jan 14, 2013 10:36PM Shayne wrote: So its been months now.  Surgery, rads.......all over with and behind me.  Then my friend who was dx 2 years ago with bc and ovarian cancers, went thru mx, recon, chemo......was dx with metastasis in her lymphs.  This was january 2012.  She lived a v full life this year.....and last monday she died.  SHe was 38.   the last few months myself and a large community of women friends took turns caring for her and visiting her.  THis brought on my anxiety again that had left me after the summer.  I am seeing a therapist, who reccommended xanax.....and also asked me if i was depressed.  Isnt that like asking an addict if they are an addict?  I dont know, I am fatigued from the aromasin.....and my insomnia is worse since starting the aromasin.  Its a viscious cycle.  Im meeting a Nurse Practitioner/PA that I trust on thursday.....and then my naturopath...to help me decide what to do from here.  Im not sure.  The anxiety isnt as bad as before.  I tried taking the xanax and it didnt help me sleep.  As I have stated, i hate pill taking.....not sure where to go from here.  I have tried mmj in tincture form.....didnt really help me sleep either.   WOuld love to hear from you ladies - hope you are doing well......

Posts.Content: Shayne wrote: Hi everyone.  Im 54 and just had my first mamo - showing 3 cysts, one that appeared solid looking or filled with blood on the ultrasound.  There were also a cluster of micro calcifications.  Im set to go to the city on Friday to a wonderful Breast Center for a biopsy.  I have 3 friends in my community that have recently been diagnosed with BC.  I have 1 sister who was diagnosed with bc 5 years ago, otherwise no other family history.  I have 2 children, one is 35 and the other is 11.  I nursed for 3 years with my 11 yr old.  I am post menopausal and did take bio-identical hormones for 2 years.  I weaned myself off of them when my sister was diagnosed.  None of my cysts can be felt - the biggest is 10mm.  They were all oval shaped with clear margins/edges. I wasnt scared, until the woman setting up my appt mentioned the microcalcifications - now Im super worried, trying to stay off the internet.   She said they MIGHT have to do a sterotactic biopsy on the calcifications, but wont know until they see my films.  My films were SUPPOSE to be Fed X to them Monday, but are being shipped today bc someone forgot!  They usually do not make appts without seeing and having the films first, but my friend who had BC a couple years ago and went to this Breast Center, made some calls for me and got me in.   I have a lot of support - but my husband is out of town and I feel very alone with this.  My sisters both live 2 states away but I have been talking to them on the phone.  Im trying to stay positive, but fear is overtaking me every 15 min or so.  Making the appt yesterday made it so real - i thought I would feel relieved, but Im not.  I have read a lot of posts on how easy the biopsy is.  Im a huge baby when it comes to needles and anything medical.  Im a v healthy person, exercise 5 x a week, have never had anything major happen to me besides having my gall bladder removed 20 years ago.  Looking for someone to talk me off the ledge - Im so scared and worried - even tho I know how useless these emotions are.  I feel like Im trying to hold it together and Im barely able to do it.  thanks for any replies and words of hope! Posts.Content: Aug 8, 2012 07:39PM - edited Aug 8, 2012 07:43PM by Shayne I got a pack of 3 cotton sports bras and basically wore them 24/7 after surgery and after rads.  Found them at Walmart for 10 bucks. Got them a size bigger for comfort, but really, didnt need to do that in hindsight.  I had one front closure sports bra - but it wasnt v comfortable and only used it after rads.  I needed something I could sleep in, and i cant sleep in a regular bra.  Find them totally uncomfortable even during the day.  Now im back to my camies and light bras.  Tho I still wear the sports bras under my stretchy workout wear just for added support when jumping around at gym or cycling.
